title: Dollar to Continue on Gradual Depreciation Path: UBP
text: Nov.29 -- Carlos Casanova, senior Asia economist at Union Bancaire Privée, discusses the outlook for the region's economies and policies amid the coronavirus pandemic, the outlook for the U.S. dollar and the implications for Asian emerging markets. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.

title: A Quick Look At Technology's Expected EPS Growth Rates In 2021
text: A Quick Look At Technology's Expected EPS Growth Rates In 2021

title: World stocks boast record-breaking month, led by Europe
text: World shares were set to seal a record-busting month on Monday as the prospect of a vaccine-driven global economic recovery next year and yet more free money from central banks eclipsed concerns about the pandemic in the near-term.

title: A Weaker Dollar Lies Ahead, SocGen FX Strategist Juckes Says
text: Nov.27 -- Kit Juckes, chief FX strategist at Societe Generale, says there is a regime change in markets that will result in a weaker U.S. dollar. He speaks on “Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: This Is a Shock, Not a Market Cycle, Says MetLife's Matus
text: Nov.27 -- Drew Matus, chief market strategist at MetLife Investment Management, says the next market cycle could look like the 1990's as the global system recovers from the shock of the coronavirus pandemic. He speaks with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on “Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: 'Extreme Measures Of Sentiment': Stock Market Update For The Week Ahead
text: What Happened: In an extension of the sharp rotation out of safety on a sustained economic rebound after the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic, stretched sentiment propelled stocks to record closing highs. Remember This: “We are starting to see some extreme measures of sentiment, as cash levels are low and equity allocation is high,” said Michael Hartnett, a chief investment strategist at Bank of America.

title: Stock futures rise slightly as Wall Street is set to wrap up a historic November
text: The Dow has risen 12.9% so far this month, on pace for its best monthly performance since January 1987.

title: Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq advanced on a weekly basis supported by the vaccine news
text: The U.S. stock indices have advanced on a weekly basis, supported by the news that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration is likely to approve the coronavirus vaccine by the mid of December. The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq reached a new record high last week, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average closed the week above 29,990 for the first time.

title: Market bull predicts holiday season surge will boost stocks another 10%
text: Capital Wealth Planning's Jeff Saut sees the S&P 500 hitting 4,000 before year-end, thanks to a holiday shopping surge in December.

title: Did Value Stocks Rise Too Far, Too Fast?
text: As money managers and investors pile into value stocks and ETFs can one really conclude that a major turn in favor of value over growth stocks has occurred? Technical analyst Tom Aspray takes a look at both the historical charts and the current technical readings to help answer this question.

title: The Tell: The Fed and the promise of a vaccine isn't enough to protect investors from a potential ‘reckoning,' top economist warns
text: Mohamed El-Erian, president of Queens' College University and economic adviser to Allianz, isn't so sure the bull run will last and he explained why in a recent interview.

title: Stock Market Hits New Highs
text: Stock Market Hits New Highs

title: Emerging Markets Poised To Be Next Beneficiary Of Pandemic Bull Market: Bloomberg
text: Money is beginning to flow into emerging markets, as investors, flush from gravity-defying stock markets, look farther afield for opportunities, Bloomberg reports. What Happened: Emerging markets are seeing greater foreign investor interest, while still having plenty of running room to go.

title: Weekly High Frequency Indicators: Further Small Signs Of Softening
text: Weekly High Frequency Indicators: Further Small Signs Of Softening

title: As The Dow Jones Industrial Average Reaches 30,000, ‘The Fed Did It' Narrative Becomes Even More Ridiculous
text: Not only is “the Fed did it” an insult to American ingenuity on par with Barack Obama's “you didn't build that,” such a stance ignores the basic truth that if U.S. stock markets were rigged by the Fed, they would be too depressed to be worth rigging.

title: It's Not Too Late to Invest in Small-Cap Stocks
text: Small-cap stocks are expected to outperform large-cap stocks in the long run because smaller companies can grow their earnings at a comparatively faster pace than their more mature peers. For this reason, it's natural to assume that investors would be willing to pay a premium to buy stocks of small companies that are in good financial shape.

title: Analysis: Investors weigh prospects for U.S. corporate earnings as stocks set records
text: As U.S. stocks scale fresh record highs, investors are trying to gauge whether next year's projected profit rebound will be strong enough to add fuel to the rally.

title: Mohamed El-Erian sounds the alarm on brewing bond-market risks
text: Many investors have chosen to look past short-term market risks in the hopes that 2021 will be markedly more upbeat. Yet, Mohamed El-Erian warned investors that the interim journey to the vaccine will be a difficult time, particularly for investors in high-yield credit. He told Bloomberg TV on Friday that deteriorating credit conditions could lead to a swath of bankruptcies before the recovery. "Credit is deteriorating, more bankruptcies are going to occur, recovery rates are going to come down," said the economist. "The big question...is how much damage do we have to the corporate sector in this journey to the vaccine?"

title: Housing REITs And Special Dividends
text: Housing REITs are finally generating interest with readers. It's about time! We're laying out several charts for the housing REITs, but the leverage charts for AIV will be off.

title: The Oil Industry Starts Climbing Out Of A Hole
text: The oil industry has had a brutal year, but it has had a pretty good month.

title: The 3 Most Dangerous Investing Bubbles Waiting to Burst
text: Irrational exuberance has returned to Wall Street, and history says it won't end well for investors.

title: 'Equity markets have devolved into casinos'
text: The belief that housing prices never go down did not seem wild to many people until the Great Financial Crisis began in 2008.  These days, baby boomers are not the only ones driving seemingly sanguine narratives that may not end well. Millennials and Gen Xers are fully in on the action as well, having put faith in the forces that drove the longest bull market in history — one which they were able to participate in.
